headline: Juiciest Hamburgers Ever
description: Juicy, flavorful hamburgers are just what you need for a perfect summer BBQ, party, or potluck, and these are super easy to prepare for guests.

video.description: No more dry, lackluster hamburgers. These are juicy, and spices can be easily added or changed to suit anyone's taste. If you find the meat mixture too mushy, just add more bread crumbs until it forms patties that hold their shape.
video.name: The Secret to the Juiciest Hamburgers

name: Juiciest Hamburgers Ever

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a grill for high heat.
Mix the ground beef, egg, bread crumbs, evaporated milk, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, and garlic in a large bowl using your hands.
Form the mixture into 8 hamburger patties.
Lightly oil the grill grate. Grill patties until browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: I’ve now used this recipe 2 times, the wife and I like it. I think people are getting a meatloaf taste because they are probably using Italian breadcrumbs - don’t use that type. Use non-flavored breadcrumbs. Also try using a bit more garlic and a little more of the cayenne pepper.

It came out really good. The burger patty actually was really. I added extra cayenne and I paired it with a pepper jack cheese and had just right amount of kick. It was really good. It was a winner with the kids but they didn't like pepper. Jack so they got regular cheddar cheese.

Awesomeness and beyond!! Just added some garlic butter instead of garlic and also some paprika, coriander, steak amd chop spices and dried parsley. Made burgers with avo, fried balsamic red onions, baked eggs, pineapple, gurkhins, fried tomato(in tomato sauce, chutney, sugar, salt & pepper), cheese and green onions. Wedges on the side(power died, so couldn't brown them properly). Was divine, DIVINE,yummy!!!!
It is the evaporated milk. It combines with the fat in the ground beef to keep it juicy. I also add honey instead of bbq sauce to give my burgers that sweet and juicy jump
Incredible, no clue how it works but this was amazing, we made a large batch 2kg meat (4pounds) and have frozen. We will turn these into Meatballs aswell. TFTR
i nutted 7 evaporated milks out of 7
These were absolutely delicious. Moist and did not break apart on the grill. The only thing I changed was the addition of a few spoonfuls of mango chutney. Will definitely make again.
These were a big disappointment. They hamburgers tasted like meatloaf. My kids hate meatloaf. I won't be trying this recipe again.

The burgers were certainly juicy, but because of all the added ingredients, they tasted like meatloaf. I will not make this recipe again although will conserved adding condensed milk to regular burger recipes.

I made this recipe but, I used 50% chuck steak, 25% hanger steak (any steak like this such as flat iron works too) and 25% boneless beef country style rib meat. The total was 5 lbs. After I coarsely ground the meat I added 20% by weight of smoked bacon, raw (1 lb) Then measured out my 2lbs of ground steak and bacon, proceeded with the recipe. I also substituted Chipotle powder for the cayenne as my sister doesn't like cayenne I make the exact substitution in my Cajun or Creole dishes. Being a former desert rat, an 1/8 tsp became a half tsp or more, don't judge. Well beat me with mommas flip-flop and call me Shirley ! I will never go back to store bought ground again. These were, without a doubt, the juiciest, tastiest burgers I ever remember grinding my molars on. Didn't take a lot of chewing, but I was put in mind of eating the tenderest steak I ever had in my life. No bun, no condiments, just pan-fried and slipped onto a plate. I can not stress this enough. Never buy ground round (dry and needs help) or "ground beef" (what parts of the "beef" ? ) to make these delightfu burgers, the extra work results in a very beefy, moist and juicy burger. If you are fortunate enough to have an actual butcher nearby, you can ask them to coarsely grind this up for you right at the counter. I used a Kitchenaid stand mixer with all metal grinding attachment. I went through all 6 lbs of meat quicker than Grant took Richmond. Took me longer to wash and dry the grinder than it took to grind the meat. Enjoy.
A family favourite!!! We also cook ours on the smoker, soooo delicious!!
This recipe is absolutely accurate. The best and juiciest hamburger I have had in a long time. Will never make burgers any other way.
It's a good place to start. Worshchersire sauce wasn't great the first time, made without it the second time and much happier. Going to add bacon next time.
Made these dozens of times. Can replace condensed milk with olive oil and Sri Racha.
I loved this recipe, My kids loved it! They insisted we had this every Sat. that it was so good! We also had to have a D.I.Y hamburger bar, ha ha ha!!!
My go to burger recipe. I make the changes suggested by others and the are a every time.
Oh cook my ! This is the perfect burger and I'm really pleased with this recipe so thank you and have a Wonderfull day.

I made this recipe as written and cooked a small amount for tasting. I found it bladder than expected. So before grilling I added more Worchestershire sauce and salt. The burgers were still not as flavorful as we would have liked. They were not at all dry, but not as juicy as they should have been with 1 lb. 80% beef and 1 lb. 94% beef. These definitely have potential with more seasoning and perhaps some liquid smoke. Will try again. Thanks for the recipe.
I added shredded cheddar cheese, and garlic powder. And we ran out of Worcestershire sauce. But all in all, they turned out pretty darn tasty.

Fantastic recipe!! It's my 'go to' for burgers and everyone raves about them. I make them exactly as per the recipe and they turn out perfect every time, wouldn't change a thing. Thanks for adding your great recipe to this page, appreciate it!
By far, the best, tastiest recipe for burgers.
Our favorite hamburger recipe and so easy to make!

GREAT RECIPE!!! My only changes were to add a sprinkle of some spices (onion powder, lemon pepper, celery salt, salt an pepper). It was so good that my family (not really burger fans) asked for a repeat again tomorrow. This is my go to recipe for burgers from now on. Thanks ever so much fir this recipe!!!
My family LOVES these burgers. I never have bread crumbs so I just crumble up whatever crackers we have in the pantry and use that. Juicy and delicious every time!
This is the best burger ever!! I have been making these for over a year, I make the patties and freeze in advance then thaw! Also I use milk if I do not have condensed milk! Easy and delicious.
Add salt and pepper, great texture though

Love this burger recipe! Found it in February, and we've had these yummy, moist burgers every couple of weeks since then. I use crushed Ritz crackers instead of bread crumbs, and add a little dried minced onion, salt and pepper.
Added fresh garlic, seasoning salt, chopped onions , and ground the oat into a fine powder.

This is similar to a meatloaf. If I got this at a restaurant, I’d be quite disappointed. I don’t know if I’d equate a soft-almost-mushy patty with a juicy burger. I followed the instructions to a “T” - all those breadcrumbs and egg start feeling resembling stuffing. Beef burgers to me are largely ground beef and no fillers. But I thought I’d try it out.
Thank you so much for sharing this recipe. It's by far the tastiest, juiciest, homemade hamburger I've ever had, let alone made!
These were delicious burgers. Were in fact, very juicy.
The easiest and the best.
We grilled in an air fryers rather than on the outside grill due to - temperatures, other than the shape changing slightly ( more of a ball shape) they were just as delicious and juicy as ever.
it is tasty but wasn't the juiciest

Juicy? Yes, but no flavor. No salt?!?!
Probably won't make it again.
Loved these, i do think it required salt, but that really is a personal thing, i also substituted evap milk with almond milk, and i air fried them instead,
Good burgers. Used a George Foreman grill because it’s snowy outside. The ingredients make them taste like baroque burgers. Loved them!!!
Great recipe. Use of every time. The o ly thing I add is 1/4 diced white onion.
Awesome, I loved the recipe
So good!!! I added chopped onions, horseradish and folded a slice of American Cheese in the middle. Best burger ever!!!
Good
Didn't even taste like meat anymore.
I substituted 1/4 cup of olive oil for the 3 T of evaporated milk. Delicious!

For lack of Worcestershire sauce (doh!) i ended up making some substitutions while doin my best to hold to the spirit of the recipe. I kept the meat, garlic, evaporated milk, etc ratios the same and used a bit of fish sauce, soy sauce, and bbq sauce to take the place of the Worcestershire. It came out well, although if I had used Worcestershire or even anchovy paste, I think it would have tasted better. 

Anyway, I used ground beef with 14% fat. The role of the bread crumbs is to act as a binder and also to absorb some of the fat that would ordinarily drip out during cooking. Not so healthy, but it makes for a nice treat once in a great while. I do agree with previous comments that say the texture of the meat changes. It does - it’s more like a soft meatball, but it also is easier to eat in a party setting because it doesn’t crumble.
We tried this recipe years ago and it's now the only burger recipe we use. I think the Evaporated Milk makes the difference.
I made these up today with a salad and they were a big hit for the whole family.
Fantastic!

juiciest burger I have ever had. also most flavorful. I highly recommend however to be careful how much evaporated milk you use cuz your burger will fall apart even if you take the meat right from the fridge to the grill. I am single so I always halve the recipe And I used more evaporative milk than I should have but it still tasted amazing. I wonder how this would taste as meatloaf. I don't use hamburger buns when I make a burger. I just top it with a tomato and ketchup and it tastes amazing.
I grill these up every summer!
Family favorite I have to practically make them every week
Amazing!! I've always had a hard time with dried out burgers, even when grilling. But no more!! This recipe left everyone amazed and loved it!! I will always use this recipe when making burgers:)
don''t waste your time on this one !
I made these for the first time tonight and the teenagers gave them a thumbs up.

Absolutely delicious!!! We made it into 6 burgers instead of 8 (just like a bigger burger). I didn’t have evaporated milk so I used regular milk but that was the only change I made. Cooked them on the smoker and they turned out incredible. Making them tonight for a second time!
Juicy as advertised! I think the recipe could use a little salt and pepper to taste. This is just a great recipe!

The best burger I have ever made. I did add onion powder, salt and pepper. But i've never been happier. This will be my go to recipe from here on out. Thank you to the person who finally figured it out!!
I like spicer food so I’ll double up on the cayenne pepper next time. I used extra lean ground so it was not juicy but I still enjoyed it.
It was lovely!
I agree with another reviewer--this was meatloaf in burger form. A good and juicy meatloaf, but not what I was looking for.
they were delicious and my wife love them, a keeper.
Great recipe. There's only three of us (and one is a kid) so unless you have a larger family/group, or want leftovers, I highly recommend halving it.
Amazing recipe by husband said they were outstanding and they really were
Added chopped onions and 1 tablespoon oil per pound of ground beef - family said it was the best burgers they've ever had!
Made this burger for a couple of picky brothers and they loved it!!
I cooked them as per recipe and the the family said they were delicious. I cook for my partner and brother, farther & mother inlaw
Didn't have any evaporated milk, was still excellent!
I made it with 1 pound organic grass fed ground beef. I added 4 teaspoons of raw onion to my meat before shaping. I ended up with 5, 4 ounce burgers. Delicious.
Delicious and yummy
No taste, make sure to add olive oil, onion and salt.
Substituted smoked paprika for cayenne. Added an extra garlic clove a sprinkle of onion powder and garlic salt. Used seasoned bread crumbs. Made 12 mini burgers. Came out great !
This is a recipe that I was not happy with. I had many burgers before this and this is the saddest. Do not do this recipe.

This burger recipe is the BEST! I did however substitute at 2/3, plain milk for the evaporated milk which I didn't have onhand. The hamburgers were amazingly juicy and tasty! This will be my forever recipe for hamburgers!
It was the best burger I have ever had!!! And I LOVE burgers!

Boy, these came out super juicy! The whole family enjoyed them.
What I altered: I used 3 lbs of beef and I added a cup of chopped onions. I also added 1tsp of liquid smoke for extra flavor, 1 tsp of paprika instead of cayenne pepper, 1 tsp of garlic pepper salt. Also, the bread crumbs I used are Italian style.
What I got: 15 chunky, juicy, round and not flat patties

We LOVED this burger. I only had one lb ground beef, so I halved the recipe. I used the egg white instead of a whole egg, and I didn't have evaporated milk, so I just left it out. I grilled them on a cast iron skillet with raised grill features. The burgers stuck a little and tried to come apart, but they all made it out in one piece. Not sure if I just didn't have the skillet hot enough or if it was the difference in the egg or the milk. Still a winner though! My husband kept interrupting his chewing to tell me how great it was!! And my 15-year-old son loved it too!
This is the only burger recipe my family will eat now!
Not sure
Juicy as promised !!
I added green seasonings
I will definitely make this again. Very good homemade burger. I used real milk and added some minced onions.
I made it exactly per the recipe and it didnt work. The burger just fell apart and then after i got it all flipped and came back to take it out it stuck to my pan and ruined it
Juicy and flavourful, my go to recipe. I double it and stock the freezer for easy meals.
I made this recipe today & it was a hit! Juicy & delicious! I will make them this way from now on!!!

Made these and it was great! However I made some changes: 
- 1 package of Sason Goya (the little packet in the box)
- Trader Joe's 21 Seasoning
- Salt + pepper
- add less breadcrumbs
Best burgers I have ever made!

Pretty good burgers. To keep it wheat free, I substituted a mix of oatmeal and almond flour for the breadcrumbs. And since I had no other use for evaporated milk, I just used some thinned yogurt. 

It's important to get the grill really hot so they sizzle right off the bat. We cooked them about 4 minutes longer so they were cooked through.
This was awesome, just added some more cayenne pepper. Thank you so much!
We made 6 patties instead of 8 so they were a little bigger. These were great!
Added 2 table spoons of olive oil as I used extra lean meat
Very juicy. I enjoyed them. I will make again soon.
Left out the cayenne, otherwise followed this recipe. Huge hit!
That is a great recipe, lovely, just need to add some spices
Tasty
This was excellent. I omitted the egg and used buttermilk as I didn't have any regular milk. Grilled over high heat, 3 minutes per side --- Perfection!
Loved it!! Our absolute favorite and go to burgers whenever we’re in the mood.
Best Hamburger I have ever had on my grill!
I just made these and everyone was raving about how juicy and delicious they are. I put some cheddar cheese in the middle and they were perfect. This is definitely now my go to recipe for burgers.

Made 32 burgers today using this recipe and 6.5 lbs of lean hamburger. Only thing I added was 2 pkgs of Lipton Onion soup mix. I had to use 1% milk instead of evaporated as that was all I had, and I used Italian flavoured bread crumbs. The burgers were scrumptious! Will definitely save for future use.
